squidpony.squidgrid.gui

Interface SGPane

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SGPanelGDX, SwingPane

    @Beta
public interface SGPane
    A basic interface for working with grids. This interface's Beta status is due to the libGDX version potentially becoming different enough that this interface is removed in favor of direct implementation of desired back end panels.
    Author:
    Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com

      • getCellWidth

        int getCellWidth()
        Returns the width of a single cell.

      • getGridHeight

        int getGridHeight()
        Returns the height of the grid. This is the number of rows in the grid.
        Returns:

      • getGridWidth

        int getGridWidth()
        Returns the width of the grid. This is the number of columns in the grid.
        Returns:

      • initialize

        void initialize(int cellWidth,
              int cellHeight,
              int gridWidth,
              int gridHeight,
              java.awt.Font font)
        Initializes the component with the supplied values. The cells will be set to the desired width and height and if the size of the font is too large, it will be shrunk until everything fits.
        Parameters:
        cellWidth - in pixels
        cellHeight - in pixels
        gridWidth - in cells
        gridHeight - in cells
        font -

      • initialize

        void initialize(int gridWidth,
              int gridHeight,
              java.awt.Font font)
        Initializes the component with the supplied number of rows and columns. The size of the display will be adjusted to match the requested font size as closely as possible.
        Parameters:
        gridWidth - in cells
        gridHeight - in cells
        font -

      • placeCharacter

        void placeCharacter(int x,
                  int y,
                  char c)
        Sets one specific block to the given character. This block is not drawn immediately, refresh() must be called to update display.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to set
        y - The y coordinate to set
        c - The character to be displayed

      • placeCharacter

        void placeCharacter(int x,
                  int y,
                  char c,
                  java.awt.Color fore,
                  java.awt.Color back)
        Sets one specific block to the given character with the given foreground and background colors. This block is not drawn immediately, refresh() must be called to update display.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to set
        y - The y coordinate to set
        c - The character to be displayed
        fore - The foreground color
        back - The background color

      • placeCharacter

        void placeCharacter(int x,
                  int y,
                  char c,
                  java.awt.Color fore)
        Sets the block at the given coordinates to contain the passed in character drawn with the given foreground color. The default background color will be used.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        c -
        fore -

      • placeHorizontalString

        void placeHorizontalString(int xOffset,
                         int yOffset,
                         java.lang.String string)
        Prints out a string starting at the given offset position. Any portion of the string that would cross the edge is ignored. The default foreground color is used and the background is not effected.
        Parameters:
        string -
        xOffset -
        yOffset -

      • placeHorizontalString

                         int yOffset,

                         java.awt.Color foreground,
                         java.awt.Color background)

        yOffset -

        background -

      • placeImage

        void placeImage(int x,
              int y,
              java.lang.String key)
        Places the image associated with the provided key at the given coordinates. If the key does not have an associated image, the factory's default null image is used.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        key -

      • placeImage

        void placeImage(int x,
              int y,
              java.lang.String key,
              java.awt.Color background)
        Places the image associated with the provided key at the given coordinates. If the key does not have an associated image, the factory's default null image is used. The background will be set to the provided Color, but will only show up if the keyed image has transparency.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        key -
        background -

      • placeText

        void placeText(int xOffset,
             int yOffset,
             char[][] chars)
        Sets the contents of the component to reflect the two dimensional character array, starting at the given offset position. The default foreground color is used and the background is not effected. Any content that would be off the screen to the right or down is ignored.
        Parameters:
        chars -
        xOffset -
        yOffset -

      • placeText

        void placeText(int xOffset,
             int yOffset,

             java.awt.Color foreground,
             java.awt.Color background)
        Sets the contents of the component to reflect the two dimensional character array, starting at the given offset position.
        Parameters:

        yOffset -

        foreground -
        background -

        Parameters:
        defaultForeground -

      • setText

        void setText(char[][] chars)
        Sets the contents of the component to reflect the two dimensional character array. Will ignore any portion of the array that is outside the bounds of the component itself. The default colors of the foreground and background will be used.
        Parameters:
        chars -

      • willFit

        boolean willFit(char character)
        Test if the given character will fit in the current cell dimension using the current Font.
        Parameters:
        character -
        Returns:
        true if it will fit, false otherwise.
